isis.stitle: ANTILOCK RELAY VALVE: AR-1 - MAINTENANCE - EVERY YEAR, 100,000 MILES, OR 3,600 OPERATING HOURS

svcproc.title: EVERY YEAR, 100,000 MILES, OR 3,600 OPERATING HOURS

step1.para: Apply and release the brakes several times and check for prompt application and release at each wheel. If prompt reaction is not noted at all wheels, test the antilock modulator between the AR-1 and the brake chamber for proper operation. If a "sluggish," or incomplete response is noted at all wheels, inspect for a kinked or obstructed air line leading to or from the AR-1.
During brake release, confirm that a slight puff of air exits at the AR-1's quick exhaust port in the cover. Air exiting at this exhaust port indicates the AR-1 integral quick release is functioning.
Build the air system pressure to governor cut-out, then apply a soap solution to the exhaust port in body. The leakage noted should not exceed a one-inch bubble in less than three (3) seconds.

Make and hold a full brake application and apply a soap solution to the exhaust ports in the body and cover and around the cover where it joins the body. The leakage noted should not exceed a one-inch bubble in less than three (3) seconds at any exhaust port.
